name: LOK SEVA SANGAM
briefDescription: Lok Seva Sangam,is an organization that works for the control of leprosy, tuberculosis, eliminate malnutrition and enhance education. It covers a population of 2.7 million in E, L and M wards of Mumbai.Cure without segregation has been its motto since inception and 300 odd deformed leprosy patients under its care are provided with physiotherapy, varied aids and appliances and dressing materials. The main aim is to detect cases in the early stages through its 15 dermatological mobile clinics and prevent impairment and disability. Tuberculosis is a life threatening ailment and is highly contagious.  LSS aims to prevent the onset of MDR and XDR by detecting patients early and convincing them to complete treatment without interruption.LSS works with 17 anganwadis to improve the outreach and efficiency of the ICDS programme.  It plays a major role in motivating the community to take an active part in the monitoring and evaluation of the programme.LSS runs 3 balwadis for children 2-5 yrs of age in Chunabhatti, Bainganwadi and Cheeta Camp and provides them with free meals, clothes and stationery.
